title: U.S. Justice Department to open Facebook antitrust investigation: source
text: The U.S. Justice Department will open an antitrust investigation of Facebook Inc , a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, marking the fourth recent antitrust probe of the social media company.

title: Facebook confirms AR glasses, reveals new mapping project
text: Facebook Inc. confirmed on Wednesday it is developing augmented reality glasses that should be ready in a few years, and announced a project called “Live Maps” that will create 3-D maps of the world.

title: Facebook exec says the company's smart glasses will help people 'connect with other humans'
text: Facebook's Andrew "Boz" Bosworth said on Wednesday that the company has a unique position in the market relative to its rivals.

title: Facebook's Oculus conference is filled with Star Wars, hand tracking and Medal of Honor: Everything announced
text: The social networking giant announced new hand tracking technology and a social game called Horizon. It also said users have spent more than $100 million in its Oculus app store so far.

title: Facebook Is Undervalued By At Least 25%- It's Dating Service Fills An Underserved Market.
text: Facebook's tremendous value and execution are often overlooked.

title: Facebook is building a ‘new social layer’ for Oculus headsets
text: Facebook spent a large amount of time at its Oculus Connect 6 keynote detailing the new links between its VR headset and the company’s core Facebook app. “Starting late this year, we will begin to roll out a completely new social layer across the Oculus platform powered by Facebook,” Oculus exec Megan Fitzgerald said onstage.

title: Facebook will soon let Oculus users build their own avatars so they can play laser tag on the moon
text: Facebook on Wednesday announced Horizon, a virtual world experience that will launch for Oculus headsets in 2020.

title: Facebook is making AR glasses, and is mapping the world for them to work
text: Live Maps is Facebook's initiative to code the real world so that future AR devices can navigate it.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg isn't giving up on Oculus or virtual reality
text: Exclusive: The head of the world's largest social network says Facebook’s chance at shaping the future starts with VR.

title: Facebook Bets Big on Human Brains Controlling Computers
text: The tech giant believes brain-computing interfaces represent the future of AR and VR.

title: Facebook's Oculus users have spent $100 million on VR content
text: The social network pushes forward with its VR efforts.

title: Facebook's Oculus wants to let you control VR with your hands
text: A new capability coming to Oculus VR headsets next year will allow you to control the device without a controller.

title: Mark Zuckerberg sees the future of AR inside VR like Oculus Quest
text: In an exclusive interview, Zuckerberg explains the path from VR to AR, and why Facebook's doubling down on its popular Quest headset.

title: Facebook announces Horizon, a VR massive-multiplayer world
text: Facebook today announced a virtual reality sandbox game where you can build your own environments and games, socialize with friends, and more. Launching in 2020, Facebook Horizon will allow users to create their own diverse avatars and hop between virtual locals through portals called Telepods.

title: Facebook Horizon will let you create your own world in VR
text: The social network is launching a test version of the social VR world in 2020.

title: Facebook announces Oculus Link which brings PC games to its standalone Quest headset
text: Oculus is going to be further blurring the lines between its standalone virtual reality headset and what it’s built on PC with a new software update in November. Oculus Link will allow Quest users to tether their Quest to PCs and play PC content that is more high-resolution and more power-intensive.

title: Facebook Tries Video Reboot With New Portal Chat Devices
text: The social media giant gets a redo with its upgraded Portal video chat devices, but it's not clear whether users will want them this time around.

title: Facebook Uses Smart Timing for Its Smart Glasses
text: Facebook joins Google, Microsoft, and others in the race towards a smarter AR experience.

title: Facebook to allow politicians to break community standards
text: Facebook will allow politicians to break its usual community standards and exempt them from its fact-checking process in order to maintain "free expression" on the platform ahead of upcoming elections.
